To properly handle servers on different ports of the same host, what
was previously called "CrawlHost" is now "CrawlServer", and captures
the robots information (which varies per server). 

The IP address info has been factored out into a new "CrawlHost" 
instance. One CrawlHost instance may be shared among many CrawlServers,
so that a single DNS lookup populates them all with IP address info.

ServerCache (the renamed HostCache) maintains both caches which
ensure that within one crawler, only one CrawlServer exists for
any "hostname:port" and only one CrawlHost exists for any "hostname".

Keep an eye out for any bugs that may have been triggered for
this refactoring. 

- Gordon
